For your second question, the issue with the jQuery UI autocomplete widget not working might be due to the way you are returning the list of usuaris from the database.

When you are returning a list of strings from the database, you need to make sure that each string is on a separate line. Otherwise, the autocomplete widget will not be able to display the suggestions correctly.

You can try modifying your code in the Controller.java file to return the list of usuaris as a string array, and then use the JSON format to return the list. This way, you can ensure that each suggestion is on a separate line.

Here's an example of how you can modify your code to return the list of usuaris as a JSON string:

<<<code>>>:
```scss
response.setContentType("text/html;charset=UTF-8");
```

Then, in your JSP file, you can modify the autocomplete code to use the JSON data:

<<<code>>>:
```javascript
<script>
    $("#usuari").autocomplete({
        source: function(request, response) {
            $.ajax({
                url: "Controller?action=llistaUsuaris",
                dataType: "json",
                data: {term: request.term},
                success: function(data) {
                    response($.map(data, function(item) {
                        return {
                            label: item,
                            value: item
                        };
                    }));
                }
            });
        }
    });
</script>
```
